text: Gurhan Kiziloz (born August 27, 1989) is a British entrepreneur. He is the founder of Lanistar, a fintech company. He is also the CEO of Nexus International Holdings, which operates online gaming platforms in Latin America. One of the platforms, Megaposta, reached over $400 million in revenue in 2024. == Early life == Kiziloz was born on August 27, 1989. He attended London Metropolitan University for a short time. He later worked in sales and trained other salespeople in Europe and the Middle East. == Career == In 2019, Kiziloz founded Lanistar, a financial technology company offering digital payment services. In 2020, the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) issued a warning about Lanistar, but the warning was later removed after the company changed its business model. After Lanistar, Kiziloz launched Nexus International Holdings. It focuses on online gaming markets in Latin America. Its main product, Megaposta, earned $400 million in 2024. The company announced plans to reach $1.45 billion in revenue by the end of 2025. These financial results have made Kiziloz known in the fintech and gaming industries. == Personal life == Kiziloz has been diagnosed with ADHD (Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder). He has spoken publicly about using this condition to improve his focus and energy at work. ==References==
title: Gurhan Kiziloz
